newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to issue T$3 bln NCDs on Saturday.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to issue T$3 bln NCDs on Saturday.

text.p: Taiwan's central bank said on Saturday it would issue T$3 billion in one-month negotiable certificates of deposit later in the day.
Bids would close at 10.30 local time (0230 GMT), a central bank official said.

During a sustained stock rally in March and April, the central bank repeatedly issued NCDs, a move seen as aiming to keep a lid on the loose liquidity that many experts said had been fuelling what then was a sizzling stock market.
The central bank has confirmed that it was responding to the liquidity sitution but denied that it was acting directly in response to the stock market bull run.

The stock market entered a consolidation in May, with daily turnover plunging to less than half of the record levels set during the big first-quarter rally. It began to rebound since May 30, with turnover also slowly recovering.
